info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:33PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Madison, northern Haywood, northern Buncombe and south central Yancey Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 233 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Marshall, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marshall, Weaverville, Mars Hill, Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, Leicester, Mount Mitchell State Park, Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, Woodfin, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland and Waterville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
